summary: "Atlas Shrugged," written by Ayn Rand in 1957, is her longest and final novel. It's about a future U.S. where businesses struggle under strict laws. The story follows Dagny Taggart and Hank Rearden as they fight against people trying to take advantage of their success. They find out about John Galt, who encourages successful people to disappear as a protest. The book ends with plans for a new society based on Galt's ideas. Despite bad reviews, it became popular and influenced many conservative thinkers. There have been attempts to make it into a movie and play.
title: Atlas Shrugged
